Meantime, this theory of Mr de Buat is of great value to the practical engineer, who at preſent muſt content himſelf with a very vague conjecture, or take the calculation of the erronneous theory of Guglielmini. By that theory, the board of three ſeet, at the depth of four inches, ſhould diſcharge nearly 3 -⅛ cubic feet per ſecond, which is almoſt double of what it really delivers.
